boardgame.name: Masters of the Universe: The Board Game – Marble Dice
boardgame.description: An extra set of 6 custom acrylic dice with a high gloss marble finish and a gold look.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Masters of the Universe: The Board Game – Clash for Eternia

boardgame.name: Masters of the Universe: The Board Game – Battlefield Playmat
boardgame.description:
Spanning 88 x 47cm, replicating the game board that comes with the game, this lush playmat is made with high-quality neoprene that helps keep components, terrain tiles, and models in place and makes them easier to pick up. The playmat measures 3mm thick and features bordered stitching for extra durability.

With the base battlemap on one side and the Castle Grayskull battle map on the other, this playmat also incorporates the tracker board, housing space for Hitpoints, Activation order, and Escalation tracking.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Masters of the Universe: The Board Game – Clash for Eternia

boardgame.name: The Good Ol' Days
boardgame.description:
publisher blub

Most people nowadays can only speculate on what it was like back when many of our elders were kids. The Good Ol’ Days is a Golden-Age Sci-fi/Horror RPG that doesn’t take itself too seriously. You play as Kids from one of the neighborhoods of yesteryear. A time where all the classic Golden Age Hollywood monster tropes of the early 1940’s and 50’s existed and are in YOUR TOWN!

The Good Ol' Days has an array of charming art throughout based on classic UPA cartoons, and is also featuring new rule system using Doodads as your main source of actions. Grab this zine, and get the neighborhood Kids together and save your town!

​Inspired by movies like The Wolf Man, Dracula, & Creature from the Black Lagoon, as well as shows like Stranger Things and Buffy ,The Good Ol' Days is designed for short campaigns or one shot adventures.

boardgame.name: The Isle of Cats: Bag 'o' Fish
boardgame.description:
Add 30 small fish meeples and 32 large fish meeples to upgrade all of the fish tokens in your game to silk screen printed meeples.

These are the same fish meeples that are included in the Kickstarter Pack.

listing.notes:
Add 30 small fish meeples and 32 large fish meeples and upgrade all of the fish tokens in youur game to silk screen printed wooden meeples.
These were the fish meeples that were only available through the Kickstarter campaign.
New! Unused Shipping and BGG fees $8

boardgame.name: Dirty Plates
boardgame.description:
Dirty Plates is an "adult" party game/card game. There are dry erase cards for the answers and license plate cards for the prompts.

A dealer displays the plate card and the rest of the players have to write down what they think the acronym on the plate card stand for. The dealer picks their favorite and that player collects the card and the points for that round. The dealer role is passed to the next person and the process repeats until the players decide it's over, at which point they tally up their points and the player with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Treasures, Traps and Mummies
boardgame.description:
Treasures, Traps and Mummies is a deckbuilding-roguelite solo game where you have to face the dangers of the pyramid, defeat the mummies, defuse traps and solve secrets to reach the treasure! Your assistant will help you in your quest, and strange relics can either help you or make your life hell!

Your goal is to reach the exit of the pyramid, without getting exhausted in the meantime.
In your turn you can play cards from your hand to defeat challenges and/or get cards from the assistant to improve your backpack (your deck).

Every challenges has its own reward!

The game comes with 5 scenarios and you can also create your own very easily! (Just contact me and I will add those to the rulebook!)

Entry for 2021 Solitaire Print and Play Contest

boardgame.name: Kult
boardgame.description: User summary: Kult 4th eddition boxed set in italian, including core rules manual, The Black Madonna scenario, Narrator's screen and other materials

boardgame.name: Dicetris
boardgame.description:
Dicetris is a roll'n'write game based on Tetris for 1-4 players.

Each round starting player rolls 5 coloured dice(1 green, 1 yellow, 1 blue, and 2 white) and draws a block shape card. Each player in turn places selected die on the card. There are only 4 space available on each card.

Next, players try to fit the dice shape onto their scoring sheets. Shapes can be rotated like in Tetris. New shapes have to touch the bottom of the scoring field or any previously placed shape.

Spaces on the scoring sheets give VPs if they have a matching colour with dice (white is not a colour) or matching value. Values of the dice can be modified, but will cost you VP. Perfectly matching shapes (scoring all 4 fields) let you score one additional field for free.

At the end of the game, players get points for:

the number of scoring fields in 2x2 squares,
the number of scoring coloured field,
fully filed rows,
unused dice modifiers.


The game is played over 10 rounds. The player with the most VP wins.

Tha game was an add-on in the croudfunding campaign of Adam Kwapiński's book "Głowa pełna gier"

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Blossom Tales 2: The Minotaur Prince
boardgame.description:
The Minotaur King has returned...and it's all your fault! Lily's back for a new "classic" action-adventure set hundreds of years after N/A!

Grandpa's latest tale takes you on a journey through haunted forests, pirate shores, and other mysterious lands across a vast open-world! Charming towns, terrible enemies, tricky puzzles, and powerful weapons await you.

Enjoy a "story within a story" as Grandpa narrates exciting moments throughout Lily's incredible adventure.

Will you help Lily defeat the Minotaur King and save her brother?

Features
Compelling main story plus engaging side-quests
Classic top-down action-adventure in a retro 2d environment
Dozens of mini-dungeons, caves, and locations to discover
Choices that influence story and events
A wide array of weapons and abilities
15+ hours of gameplay

boardgame.name: Chaos Rift
boardgame.description:
A kingdom on the crossroads gets invaded by its greedy neighbours. On the brink of defeat, its wizards launch the final retaliation - they open a rift to the realms of chaos. Mighty demons with their servants swarm the land, turning it into waste. The invading kingdoms face an opponent they are not ready for. Regular armies are helpless against horrors of wraiths, turning people into possessed who fight against their own kind. Only elite units, heroes and battle mages dare to face the dark forces. The goal is to buy time for the archmages to prepare a spell that would close the rift. The help might come too late - if the destruction of the lands is too severe, people will abandon hope and wait defenceless for the doom.

Players - alone or in 2-player teams - take the role of chaos forces and the defending kingdoms. The chaos has the upper hand - they decide which kingdom will be invaded and with which forces. The defenders have to predict the attack directions and send their forces there. They are not completely blind - their scouts and clairvoyants can detect enemy’s movements. Chaos forces crave resources that are spread across the land - this also gives hints where they would like to strike. Some kingdoms are more vulnerable - or resistant - against some types of attacks, but the best strike is often the most obvious one. Both sides have to raise new armies - their starting forces need reinforcements as the units need rest after every battle. Defender gets a constant flow of volunteers, which can be slowed down by the chaos attacks on recruitment sites. Chaos forces need resources taken from the lands to raise new armies and launch the attacks. As their domain gets bigger, the conquered sources of resources get depleted. Chaos armies can pillage the lands for additional resources but this comes at the cost of time.

This is where the game starts - chaos leaders have 8 rounds of time to destroy the most vital parts of the kingdom, so that any help from the archmages comes too late. They have to find a way to plan successful attacks deceiving the defenders. Defending players have to deduct chaos assaults and counter them. Wrong guess of direction gives an opportunity to fortify the borders against future attack. Wrong choice of the defending unit still slows the opponent down. Right unit at the right border will stop the invasion - at least this time.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Het Zeeuwsch-Vlaams Familiespel
boardgame.description:
It is one of a series of Monopoly style board game developed for funraising in the Netherlands for a local Kiwanis group. The games in the series are essentially the same, but as in the different versions of Monopoly, the board and the businesses are specifically themed to the town or city represented in the title - in this case a geographic region in the Netherlands around the city Axel.

Players progress around the board as a result of the roll of 2D6. When landing on a Company square a player may purchase a share in that company (there are two shares available in each company), if he wishes. If not he may put the share up for auction, with any excess over the sale price being retained by that player as his fee for being the auctioneer.

Players landing on companies that are already owned must pay to visit, with the payment due being based on how many shares are owned in that particular company and in the other two companies in the same colour series. Since shares can be owned by two different players both may demand payment from a visitor.

Certain squares on the board require the drawing of a Chance card which normally result in income being received from or paid to the bank.

The “New Share Quotations” square results in the changing of share prices for some of the blocks of companies. This will result in players losing or gaining money on the shares that they own. It also requires players to put up one of their shares for auction thereby permitting players to trade in shares.

The game can be ended in three ways, which should be decided before the game starts:
- After a set time.
- When the first player becomes bankrupt.
- When all but one player has gone bankrupt.

At the end of the game the money is counted and shares are valued at whatever is the then current rate. The player with the greatest assets is declared the winner.

boardgame.name: Dice Forge: The Horn of Plenty promo card
boardgame.description:
Promotional card offered to the winners of the official "Challenge of the Gods" 2021 qualifying tournament.

This unique card is the only one to offer 3 different effects: immediate, reinforcement (activation), and permanent!

The Horn of Plenty card has 3 types of effects. The immediate effect is on the front of the card. Once the feat is completed, turn the card over to find the reinforcement (activation) and permanent effects on the back.

Immediate Effect: Choose one side of each of your dice. Replace your dice on your Inventory displaying the chosen faces. Apply the powers of the displayed dice faces, as if you were receiving favours from the gods.

Permanent effect: Choose a face on your clear die. Replace it on your Inventory with the chosen side showing and apply its power, as if you were receiving a minor favour.

Reinforcement Effect Activation Condition (activation): After you have been chased by another player.

Reinforcement Effect (Activation): Choose a side on your dark die. Place it back on your Inventory with the chosen face up and apply its power, as if you were receiving a minor favour. Then give this card to the player who kicked you out. He is the new owner (until he is kicked out in his turn).

Important: The immediate effect is only fulfilled when the player who normally performs the feat first acquires the card. Players who get the card by chasing the card owner can only get the permanent and reinforcement (activation) effects.

Note: Only the player who owns the card at the end of the game scores the 10 victory points granted by the card.

boardgame.name: Notaufnahme: das kranke Kartenspiel
boardgame.description:
This card game was crowdfunded via startnext.com. It is about treating patients in the emergency room. It contains patients, doctors, nurses, other professions, special cards and action cards.

Try treating as many patients as possible while getting rid of your initial 6 hand cards. Every turn you can place one of your cards in the middle, if this is not possible you must draw a card from the pile. As soon as someone‘s last card was played, the round stops and points/band aids will be counted for each player.

Whoever manages to collect the most points after 10 rounds, wins the Game.

boardgame.name: No Dice
boardgame.description:
Players use five dice to create math equations and try to score as close to zero as possible. Three dice have numbers while two dice have arithmetic operators (plus, minus).

Player roll dice up to 3 times to make an equation and score points. The final remaining player to not reach or exceed 30 points wins.

boardgame.name: Wordwise!
boardgame.description:
Players roll letter dice to get as many words as possible in one minute.

The first player to finish checking off a list of word categories in his/her scorepad wins.

boardgame.name: Cyberpunk 2020 - German 2nd edition
boardgame.description: This book features a new translation of the core rules and also includes the Blackhand's Street Weapons 2020 book (which was never published as a stand-alone book in German).

boardgame.name: Blots Card Game
boardgame.description:
Players try to predict what Roscharch-style blots on each card mean to another player.

The first player turns over 2 cards - a blot card and a card with 3 possible answers. He also lays face down a number card choosing his answer. Other players lay a card face down, choosing the number of the answer they pick. Points are awarded depnding on the answers picked.

The first person to 10 points wins.

boardgame.name: Aladdin: The Mystical Boardgame
boardgame.description:
Players start on any start space and roll the die to move. They can move in any direction except through the walls! They may not land on a space occupied by another player.

When landing on lamp spaces, they collect a lamp. When landing on instruction spaces, they must follow the instructions. Some are good, some are bad!

The object of the game is to move around the board collecting six lamp tokens, and then be the first to deliver the lamps at the centre of the board where the treasure is!

In the longer game rules, players must collect four lamp tokens with different numbers on them.

boardgame.name: Roll Out! Dice Game
boardgame.description:
Players take turn rolling two dice to either 'bear off' their checkers by rolling the corresponding numbers (or combination of numbers) or flip their opponent's checkers to make it harder for their opponent to bear off his/hers (essentially adding an extra step for each checker flipped).

Players can continue rolling dice until they win or roll out (dice combination cannot be satisfied by checkers).

boardgame.name: Synthesis
boardgame.description:
It is a game in which you have to get the chemical elements to be the first to complete chemical compounds.

On your work table you will have the different chemical compounds and you will have to get the element cards to synthesize them. The action cards will help you in your mission. Players can negotiate for cards, discard from their hand or synthesize their compounds.

A good hand management and strategy planning will be fundamental to play the cards well and be the fastest. The game ends when the first player succeeds in making all their compounds.

A balanced and effective mechanics of race, hand management and Take That! that will be a familiar challenge. A fun game in which chemistry will make sparks fly.

boardgame.name: Citystate 2
Citystate II
boardgame.description:
A new Citystate is on the rise! Combining the classic city building game experience with advanced macro-economics, Citystate II ambitions to become the most realistic urban simulator ever made. Wish-list now!

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Clanfolk
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





Clanfolk is life sim set in the highlands of medieval Scotland.Live off the land using historically accurate tools and processes to survive while building a growing settlement for your Clan. Every tile on the map has a purpose. Where you place your settlement, and how you built it, really matters.

You are meant to care for and care about the Clanfolk. They will try to follow your work orders while also intelligently trying to fulfill their own personal needs. Get to know your Clanfolk as they live their entire lives in your care.

The world is fully simulated, and the largest threat is nature itself. Initially food will be plentiful and the nights warm. There is lots of time to plan and enjoy the medieval homestead atmosphere. As the seasons change, resources will become more scarce and careful planning becomes more important. Surviving your first winter is very unlikely.

Colony Sim

The Clanfolk's homestead will begin as a wilderness surrounded by mountains, forests, grasslands, and lakes. Over time it may develop into an industrial farm, or a livestock ranch, or a bustling trading post, or a quiet forest Inn, or maybe a hidden mountain fortress.


Build sealed structures out of Floor, Wall, and Roof tiles.
Structures track lighting, warmth, beauty and various unhappy smells.
Windows allow ambient lighting into rooms.
Use wall torches and fires to heat, light, and occasionally burn down straw houses.
Venting system to allow fire and body heat to travel from room to room.
Door locking system to keep Clanfolk, visitors, and livestock where they belong.
Storage container objects to keep the ground clutter under control.
Crafting can be prioritized, scheduled daily, and also controlled by maintaining a desired supply.
Till the land, plant seeds, water them, add fertilizer, harvest, re-till the soil, and start again. All automated to the level you desire
Care for livestock from birth. Keep them warm, dry, fed, watered, and clean their stalls.
Learn just how hard it was to make a linen shirt. Grow the flax, thresh out the seed, throw the stalks in a river, let them rot for months, strip the loosened fibers from the stalks, spin the fibers into thread, weave the threads into cloth on the loom, and THEN sew your linen shirt!


Life Sim

Clanfolk live their whole lives on the Clan homestead, from birth until death over multiple generations. Clanfolk follow daily schedules, waking up before sunrise, taking their morning meals, washing up, and maybe having a conversations before the day's work starts. Throughout the day, they will work as hard as their mood and health will allow. In the evening, they finally all come back together to eat, drink, have a chat, maybe play the flute for a while, then off to bed, hopefully a little better off than the day before.


Clanfolk needs include: Hunger, Thirst, Sleep, Warmth, Cleanliness, Bathroom, Social, Fun, Beauty, and the inexplicable need for Plaid
When needs are not within safe ranges, then afflictions may result. These afflictions can range from having a bad mood, to a cold that slowly deteriorates into pneumonia.
Clanfolk have many skills which are improved through use. Skills can be prioritized or disabled to give Clanfolk different job roles to best utilize their skills.
Babies inherit some skill proficiency from their parents. They are mostly time vampires, but they are cute and keep everyone's' mood up (during the day)
Babies grow into Juveniles that begin to provide labor. Juveniles are idea sponges, working slowly but learning much faster than adults.
When Juveniles become Adults, their learning slows, but Adults finally work at full speed. Ideally, their childhood will have been spent on jobs that they enjoy, making them experts by adulthood. Another benefit of adulthood is the ability to have children to grow the Clan.
Eventually Adults become Seniors. Seniors work and move more slowly than Adults, but they have the highest skills and provide learning bonuses to others working near them.
Finally the Seniors will be unable to work and will need to be cared for. Clanfolk are able to understand the needs of other Clanfolk and are able to take care of the sick and injured, fulfilling all their needs when possible. Once the Senior dies, they can be buried in the family plot, and the cycle continues.


World Sim

The seasons in Clanfolk never seem long enough. Winter is always approaching and your time needs to be spent wisely. Each Season has ranges of temperature, rain, snow, wind, and even windchill. Some seasons are for growing and others for harvesting. Winter is for staying inside a warm room and processing the materials collected throughout the year.


All four seasons have smooth transitions between them, ever advancing and changing each day.
Sparks start fires that spread throughout the environment based on moisture and object flammability.
Plant growth system that is aware of ground moisture as well as fertility level, which can be changed with watering and fertilizer.
Overlays to quickly show fertility, moisture, heat, and beauty.


Neighbor Clans

Visitors will occasionally arrive from neighboring Clans surrounding the homestead. Over time your reputation with these neighbors can grow based on how they are treated as guests, workers, or traders. As your reputation increases with these Clans, contact will strengthen, providing better opportunities.


Each neighbor Clan comes from a different Biome with different products and desired items for trade. The savvy player can run a profitable trading post if there is enough trade traffic from different Clans.
As seasons progress, different items become more scarce and therefore more expensive.
Neighbor clans have intrinsic skill bonuses based on their Clan type as well as their Biome. When looking for the best workers (and potential partners) keep these in mind.
Neighbors do not send their best and brightest visitors until relations between the player Clan and the neighbor are strong.


Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Masters of the Universe: The Board Game – 3D Pack Rocks Set
boardgame.description:
These 3D rocks replace the cardboard overlays of the Clash for Eternia Core Box. The 3D Pack: Rocks Set Optional Buy includes:

2 Curved 3-Hex Rock
2 Triangle 3-Hex Rock

1 Cross 4-Hex Rock

—description from the publisher

7 Various Shrub & Plants

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Crawlyard
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





Crawlyard is a roguelike deckbuilder where you create your own adventure and use puppets to explore the everchanging Mansion of Whispers.Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Diplomacy is Not an Option
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





In the RTS-game “Diplomacy is Not an Option”, you will become a medieval feudal lord in a midlife crisis. Due to your position, you must constantly make hundreds of decisions a day related with city- management and economic development.
You are tired of this monotonous and, so it seems, meaningless existence. But things are about to change: hordes of bloodlusted enemies, zounds of scary monsters and crowds of rebellious peasants at any second can bring some life to your working schedule.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: The Bone Den
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

This is the first of four dungeons for use with Mausritter, produced using the Adventure Site Generator on mausritter.com, and illustrated with the amazing cartography of the one and only Dyson Logos.

boardgame.name: Star Scrappers: Orbital Envoys Expansion
Star Scrappers: Orbital Gesandte
스타 스크래퍼: 오비탈 사절 확장
boardgame.description:
The Envoys expansion is a exclusive gift for all supporter of the crowdfunding campaigns. Cards in this include:

Overlord Pash'tet - Immediately damage 1 module.
Custodian Anika - Immediately take any 1 card from the discard pile into hand.
Representative Ur - Immediately gain 4 crew.
Chief Engineer Batrii - Your repair actions cost 1 MC less.
Colonel T. Jones - You are always immune to money losses caused by other players' cards.
Domina Loeb - Immediately gain 1 MC per each module in a color of your choice on your orbital.
Commandor Daar - Protects against "Covert Ops" and "Sabotage" card effects.
Ancient Ursur - Building science modules cost 1 MC less.
Guildmaster Vorin - You can purchase cards from the market for 1 MC less (minimum 1 MC).
Harmonix Kira - Immediately gain 2 VP.

boardgame.name: Star Scrappers: Orbital – Deluxe Crew Set
boardgame.description: Exclusive awesome astronaut miniatures made of organic glass.

boardgame.name: City of Cats
boardgame.description:
From the back cover:

Welcome to the City of Cats, where some very ambitious people have their paws and claws out, where thieves prowl, and where the goddess Bastet herself walks the streets!

This city gazetteer and adventure collection is a perfect introduction to the Southlands campaign setting. It also fits neatly into any desert setting where cats are sacred and rats are cautious and sly.

boardgame.name: A Day of Infamy, The Attack on Pearl Harbor December 7, 1941
boardgame.description: A two player game on the Japanese attack on the US Naval base at Pearl Harbor on Oahu, 7 December 1941. It is a two player game, with 32 counters and one 8.5" by 11" map. Rules and a separate sheet with Random Events and the Designer's Notes are included. This game came with the ATO Annual 2019, La Vendee 1793, which was published in 2021. 2 six-sided die and standard card deck (with one Joker card) are also needed to play.

boardgame.name: Dacia and Thracia - Storm at the Empire's Borders
boardgame.description:
From the back cover:

Dacia and Thracia - Storm at the Empire’s Borders is a Lex Arcana, Second Edition geographic module about two of the darkest provinces of the Danubian limes, and about the mysterious regions beyond: plains roamed by proud and indomitable hordes, wild and boundless forests, and cemeteries hiding terrible blood secrets.

Here, the Roman conquest has brought a faint light to a dark and tumultuous world, trappings of civilization to tame a bloodthirsty and stubborn beast.

War and invading barbarians are still a solid reality, an aspect of everyday life never as present in the rest of the Empire as it is here. Citizens, foederati, and servants live in the shadows of mighty fortifications, echoing with the clashing of steel and glimmering with the faint light of torches that barely keep at bay the dark of the night and the monsters hiding within.

boardgame.name: Italia - Land of ​Ancient Magic and Dark Intrigue
boardgame.description:
From the back cover:

Italia - Land of Ancient Magic and Dark Intrigue is a geographic module for Lex Arcana, Second Edition. This volume is divided into two sections. The first, which includes Parts I, II, and III, can be read by both players and Demiurges. These pages describe the mysterious, political, and magical aspects of Italia, without providing details on game mechanics or elements of mystery that players will be able to discover by playing. Even when a monster or an NPC is mentioned or described, the description provided reflects what could be learned from the rumors of the place, containing many elements of truth, but also some inaccuracies, or even some errors. The precise description, complete with statistics or game rules, is provided in the second section (Parts IV and V), which is reserved for Demiurges. The last part (Part VI) is also reserved for the Demiurges and contains three adventures set in the province.

boardgame.name: Nerves of Steel: A Film Noir Story Game
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Nerves of Steel ​is a freeform story game that tells the same kind of stories you would find in film noir movies of the 1940s and 1950s. It is told from the point of view of a single character who is drawn into a mystery and tries to see it through to its sordid ending. Starting from a blank page, you'll end up with a tight, well-constructed tale of deception, betrayal, crime and maybe—just maybe—honor
boardgame.rpg: Nerves of Steel: A Film Noir Story Game

boardgame.name: Spark RPG (Open Beta)
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Spark is a roleplaying, storytelling game with a lot of moving parts. The book starts with the Introduction where I explain what the game is about and what you need to start playing.

After that, I show you how you can create your own Setting or use a premade one. Each of the players creates their own Characters who interact with each and with the setting.

The Gameplay chapter explains how you actually get to playing. This is followed by Guidance helps you have more fun while you play the game.

Lastly, there is a series of three premade settings (NeoNippon, Old Cold City & The Republic of the Elements) that you can use for your game.

The end of the book has a series of appendixes including various templates, sheets, a glossary of terms and an index. There is a credits section for the fine people who helped me refine the game.

boardgame.name: Space Opera II Development Pack
boardgame.description:
User summary:

An apparently unauthorized reproduction of both booklets presented in Space Opera, Space Opera II Development Pack is encountered in two basic format s - a two document set (Volume 1 & Volume 2 - dating from ca. 2002), and a one document version (contains both Volumes, back-to-back - dating from ca. 2015).

The document is not a scanned or facsimile reprint, but a fully typeset and formatted document. It does not contain credits or indexes.

boardgame.name: Enchantments of the Multiverse
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Enchantments of the Multiverse is a huge, consolidated magic item sourcebook that gathers up virtually every magic item produced for Otherverse Games modern and futuristic campaign settings from multiple sourcebooks.

User summary:

Portions of this item require the use of d20 Modern Core Book.

boardgame.name: Guide to the Known Galaxy
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Guide to the Known Galaxy is a sourcebook for the Otherverse America setting, and details the universe beyond the Earth of 2107 C.E. and humanity's place within it.

User summary:

This item require the use of d20 Modern Core Book.

boardgame.name: Compendia Creatura
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Creatures [presented in the document] have stat and description blocks outlining their attributes, special abilities, and information regarding their habits, habitat, and social structure.

boardgame.name: Weird Magic Items
boardgame.description:
From the back of the introduction:

[These magic items] were submitted as part of a contest to present a simple magic item (suitable for play with Lamentations of the Flame Princess (Grindhouse Edition)).

boardgame.name: Valda's Spire of Secrets
boardgame.description:
From the Kickstarter:

[T]he biggest, most exciting expansion ever made for DnD 5th edition. Bring your next character to life with 10 new base classes and 150+ subclasses, and fill their spellbook with 130+ new spells. Use new races and brand new customization options to make your character completely unique. Bring new adventures to your table and reinvigorate your love of 5E with Spire of Secrets.

boardgame.name: Strange Owlchemy
Valda's Spire of Secrets Starter Kit
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Valda's Spire of Secrets Starter Kit is an archive containing multiple PDF files, including:


29-page adventure "Strange Owlchemy"
2-page print-and-play GM screen
2-page print-and-play character sheet
ten character class playbooks, including Alchemist, Captain, Craftsman, Gunslinger, Investigator, Martyr, Necromancer, Warden, Warmage, and Witch, totaling 152 tradeback-sized pages

boardgame.name: Dungeons & Dragons Fantasy Adventure Game Omnibus Rulebook
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Dedicated to 40 years of Adventures and Gamers, both Past and Present.

This work is a fan-made production created under the Fan Content Policy. No association with Wizards of the Coast, LLC or TSR, Inc. is suggested or implied. All content remains the property of its respective owners.
...
"[The original] rules were written for people with a background of gaming experience. This revision was designed to be easily read and used by individuals who have never before played a role playing game.

"In the half-dozen years since the original rules were published, the TSR staff has answered thousands of rule’s questions. The answers helped find the problem areas in those rules, areas which could stand minor improvements or were difficult for novice gamers to understand. This revision was aided not only by the collected gaming experience of TSR personnel but by the gaming experience of the thousands of players and DMs who sent us letters in the mail."

User summary:

The "introduction", quoted above, is attributed to Tom Moldvay, 1980, and was copied from a commercially-published version of the game.

boardgame.description:

A nature for jay dragon's pastoral rpg, wanderhome, a fallen star is a place where a star fell. It is now cloaked in astral magic, providing an odd yet cleansing atmosphere.

boardgame.name: The Gourmand

a playbook for jay dragon's pastoral RPG, wanderhome, in which you play as someone who deeply enjoys the art of cookery, and takes great time and pleasure in preparing and eating food.

Following in the footsteps of C3i Nr30's South Pacific, Burma: The Forgotten War is a new Empire of the Sun standalone scenario module focused on the conflict in the China-Burma-India WWII theater from mid-1943 to its savage conclusion at the Battle of Imphal-Kohima in 1944.

Published in C3i magazine nr. 35

boardgame.name: Skärgårdsflottan!
boardgame.description:
This short pack is a supplement for LFG’s popular Cannon, Cross and Crescent Renaissance naval rules, covering the Russian and Swedish coastal fleets of the 1700s and 1800s.

The Skärgårdsflottan from which the rules derive their name was the remarkable Swedish Archipelago Fleet, a fleet comprised of many unique ship and barge designs developed by the naval architect Fredrik af Chapman.
These ships comprised everything from front line warships to troop and horse carriers, floating barracks, hospital ships and workshops and supported not only naval operations but operations on land. To capture this characteristic of combined operations warfare in the Baltic a new section of rules has been included to cater for actions on land.
Also included are comprehensive stats for the Russian and Swedish coastal warships of the era.

–Description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Gray Merchant of Asphodel

They include adventuring gear, rings, potions, rods, armor, and weapons! Items inspired by the text or art of Magic cards are hyperlinked so you can see the source material yourself.

boardgame.name: Twisted Fables: Red Playmat

boardgame.name: Twisted Fables: Alice Playmat
boardgame.description: 650mm x 345mm playmat featuring the artwork of Alice

boardgame.name: Twisted Fables: Snow Playmat
boardgame.description: 650mm x 345mm playmat featuring the artwork of Sleeping Beauty

boardgame.name: The Apocalypse War
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In humanity’s bleak future, a city with a population numbering in the hundreds of millions is watched over by a totalitarian regime who invests its Judges with the authority to dispense instant justice. Life in Mega-City One is a dazzling panoply of bizarre outfits, outrageous fads, short-lived highs and excruciatingly long lows. The gigantic Citi-Blocks and crumbling tenements of yesteryear shelter a hodgepodge of people and aliens, all largely striving to survive the daily grind of the Big Meg.

But life doesn’t just stop at the walls of Mega-City One. The vast metropolises of the Sov Block and other nations also continue to grind out their own existence from the poisoned soil around them. Sov Block’s shining jewel, East-Meg One, glares across the polluted waters of the Black Atlantic with open hatred at the decadent lives being led by their old foes in the west. In the early 22nd Century, plots and schemes soon lead to a war that is apocalyptic in proportions.

Much more than an expansive look at the epic saga from the comic story line, the Apocalypse War supplement also offers all the tools and guidance necessary to run the titular campaign plus any number of scenarios set around the chaos and devastation of the war. Grab your stub gun and patch up your wounds, it’s time to join the resistance!
boardgame.rpg: Judge Dredd and the Worlds of 2000 AD

boardgame.name: SoroPlay GamTools Zine Special: Slasher Ref
boardgame.description:
From human-masked figures to inhuman beings wielding butcher knifes, machetes, axes, pitchforks, claws, chainsaws, spears, hooks, and more—fiction slashers stalk, chase, pursue, seek revenge, torment, slaughter, and massacre neighborhoods, camps, motels, inns, factories, small towns, and even urban cities.

This even has a tool to help generate random adventure story scene synopsis or new dialogue based on interpreted results.

boardgame.name: Let's Get Paid
boardgame.description:
publisher blurb

This is a super slimmed down version of an ongoing heist game I’m working on. If you’re interested in the more complex version, please reach out to me! I also have another microRPG that you can tag onto this, if things go really poorly for the players, which you can find at Get into The Van.

boardgame.name: Dim
boardgame.description:
publisher blurb

With the shattering of our sun, a small group of heroes have been instilled with the star's dying power. Will it be enough as they search for a new sun, or will they be corrupted by shadow?

boardgame.name: Weapons & Armors

Wonders To Behold!

Find Interesting and powerful magic items on the fly. Inside you’ll find 50 unique magic items ranging in rarity from common to legendary.

boardgame.description:
Compatible with:
Imperium Legends

Details:
Tested with premium sleeved cards.
This product does not require assembly.

Insert size: 17,7 cm x 26 cm x 7 cm.
The product won't lift the lid.

boardgame.name: Global Warming: Point of No Return
boardgame.description:
World is in turmoil! Global warming changed world's shape and you take the role of United Nation (UN) secretary or ruler of one of six continents and try to find a way out of this mess, before it's too late.

Global Warming: point of no return is a game for 1-6 players, where you manage world resources, react to disasters and try to develop better technology to survive difficult time.

Game is played in turns and each player has to draw a card from event deck and apply the event ( usually bad ), but each card has also option to buy it and add to player zone as new possible action in future turns!

boardgame.name: Dastbaaf
Persian Carpet
boardgame.description:
In Persian Carpet board game, each player plays as a carpet weaver artist, weaving carpets in their workshop and competing against other players to sell more carpets (matching the order cards they receive).

The game plays in several rounds (depending on the number of players), and scores will reveal the winner at the end of the final round. Each round contains four phases: 1- Receiving money; 2- Buying yarns; 3- Weaving carpets; and 4- Selling carpets.

At the start of each round, each player receives money from the bank. Then they go to any of the two available markets to buy the yarns they need. Yarn colors with more demands are more expensive.

Any player who has all their needed yarns can start weaving the carpets by rolling dice to fulfill the order cards. Then, each player who has a completed carpet may sell it for money and victory points.

The game ends after a certain number of rounds, and the player with the highest score is the winner of the game.

boardgame.name: Heckmeck am Karteneck
boardgame.description:
Heckmeck am Karteneck is the game where ripped-off chickens shovel the worms a la carte from the grill.

Dinner is served. Tasty portions of fried worms are waiting to be fetched from the grill. In turn, the chickens play out their card stakes. Whoever quits earlier gets less, but still has cards up his sleeve for later rounds. Clever play is made by those who judge their hand of cards well at the right moment and can thus get hold of the most valuable portions.

A must for all Heckmeck lovers.

In each round, cards from the hand are played to gain worm portions of different values. Each player lays out cards. Cards of the same value may not be placed by the same player in subsequent rounds. Gained portions are stacked in front of each player, and the last portion won (on top) can be stolen. The thief can be any player who, whose total of played cards, at the time of his or her own exit, matches the value of the stolen portion.

The game ends after all worm portions have been taken. The winner is the player who has the most worms on his gained portions.

boardgame.name: Gut Pile Card Game
boardgame.description:
Gut Pile is a set collection card game with an Alaskan Hunting theme. Players play cards to acquire gut piles from their hunting trip. The first player with 3 gut piles ends the round of play. The player with the highest score wins the game.

Players can play various types of cards including type of game, terrain, equipment to increase their score. Players can also place action cards to present a challenge to another player decreasing his score or blocking a pile altogether. The rules state 2-8 players with games lasting up to 2 hours.

boardgame.name: The Bad Karmas And The Curse of the Zodiac
boardgame.description:
Okay, so 12 horrifying gigantic demigods called Zodiacs have awoken and want to extinguish human civilization. Pretty crappy day. And it turns out only you and your band of unlikely heroes can defeat these monster a-holes and save us all. Ready? Yeah, you were born ready.

The Bad Karmas and The Curse of the Zodiac is a cooperative tactical boss-battle board game with an engaging digital dimension. Work together to defeat the 12 Zodiacs who evolve and respond in real-time to player actions, creating a tabletop experience like no other. The game comes with smart miniatures, board, dice, a free companion app, and the new Teburu game platform, which keeps tracks of everything on the smart board and enhances gameplay with artificial intellingence for the enemies, vivid visuals, exciting sounds, and dramatic storytelling. Encounter unique spectacular battles, surprising moments, and epic cinematic events all brought to life with Teburu. Adventure doesn't come much bigger!

boardgame.name: Colt Express: Convoyeurs & Train blindé
Colt Express: Couriers & Armored Train
boardgame.description:
The Colt Express: Couriers & Armored Train expansion brings a breath of fresh air to the 2015 Spiel des Jahres-winning Colt Express. Players now work together as teams to try to become the wealthiest bandits in the Wild West, and what's better than a second train containing precious documents to spice up the adventure? As soon as they hear this, our famous bandits do not hesitate for a second, jumping from train to train to try to steal these documents on top of everything else up for grabs — but the shotguns roam wild and the Gatling on the roof does not bode well. On top of everything else, bandits have to be back on the starting train at the end of the last round if they want a chance to win.

This expansion introduces a new 3D train with special cars, two new bandits (Misty and the Twinz, each with new powers), a double team mode with the possibility of betraying your team or not, and an AI Bandit, Il Professore, to allow you to play with an odd number of players and a new action card to nudge a bandit from your team.

boardgame.name: 50 Missions: Ça se complique
boardgame.description:
Cooperation is key in 50 Missions: Ça se complique. Play cards to one of four piles by matching color or number. Work together as a team to complete a series of goals — without communicating what's in your hand. Can you make all piles purple or green? Every card lower than four? All cards add up to ten?

50 Missions: Ça se complique is intended to be played by people familiar with 50 Missions. It's a standalone sequel but both games can be mixed together in various game modes.

50 Missions: Ça se complique is first of all 50 new missions (more diverse and more mischievous than ever). But it's also the golden "1" allowing you to choose the next player, as well as missions preventing you to play on certain piles or missions allowing special actions or avoiding certain rules.
Yes it's trickier for sure but only for your greatest pleasure!

boardgame.name: Luminescent Letterman
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

A disposable athlete past their prime. Once entertaining the decrepit masses, now forgotten to time. Their vibrant and luminous skin clings firmly onto their overworked muscle with little need to ever be used. Branded with numbers into their chest and back; they are constantly reminded of what once was.

Luminescent Letterman is a character class compatible with MÖRK BORG, inspired by has-been professional athletes who seek attention constantly. Each ability is based on a famous sport or activity.

boardgame.name: Travelling Cigar Cart of the Spurious Basilisk
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Made for the Bad-Basilisk Berg-Borg Jam. Contains a relatively friendly cigar selling npc(s) and their cigars which may or may not have some secret magical effects.

boardgame.name: Lobotomy 2: Manhunt
boardgame.description:
Lobotomy 2: Manhunt is the sequel of Lobotomy.
In this cooperative survival horror board game. Each of you will play as a patient of a mental asylum. The monstrous staff will do everything to keep you in so you will have to use your unexplainable powers to escape. Be sure to find the difference between reality and delusions before it is too late.

Lobotomy 2: Manhunt has greatly improved since last game but still keeps the original Lobotomy spirit and atmosphere. It features:

modular map with asylum parts and outdoor parts (yes now you can check the asylum's surroundings)
best parts of Lobotomy such as cooldown system and Warden-based timer are still here
streamlined combat, movement and character management
new characters with personal goals
crafting system - improve your weapons and equipment by collecting junk
story-heavy scenarios. With the addition of scenario book game is now more thematic than ever. Explore the board which can expand during the game and hold more secrets and goals
scenarios can be played separately but they have a story continuity. There is also a "Sandbox" mode for an endless replayability (similar to the Lobotomy 1)

boardgame.name: Oz
boardgame.description:
Dorothy and Toto have arrived to the land of Oz inside a Cyclone. They must reach Emerald City with their good friends. Players must help the characters travel the road that will take them to Emerald City.

Players will draw and play cards from the different Travel decks (North, South, East and West), where they will find sections of the road for each character, the characters themselves, allies, and fearsome enemies, like the wicked witches, that will try to prevent them from reaching their destination.

The game ends when the Travel decks run out of cards. Once the game ends, check which player has helped the characters advance the most. That player is the undisputed winner in the wonderful Land of Oz.

boardgame.name: RPGPundit Presents (Issue 106)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

From the annals of the RPGPundit's (in)famous Last Sun gonzo fantasy campaign, this scenario sends you on a search for the ruins of an ancient, now sunken ship that potentially holds great treasures. Are their allies to be trusted and is there actually any treasure? This scenario is easily ported to any OSR game, especially gonzo-themed campaigns.
boardgame.rpgissueversion: Perils of the Sunken Skyship PDF

boardgame.name: Villains NPC Codex
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

From shadowy organizations to evil cults, high profile bandits, mobsters and more comes a Spheres of Power and Might NPC Codex! Take your games to a new level with prebuilt NPC characters for the Spheres subsystem, including how these NPCs were built, adjustment recommendations, and tactics blocks!

These NPCs are the working hands and elite members of three unique factions: the nefarious outlaw group the Blackthorn Consortium, the mysterious evangelical Cult of Kas’shan, and the tight-knit Rat Skull Mafia. From fusiliers and striker leaders to zealots, evangelists, and thugs, this NPC Codex features a wide variety of spheres-built NPC characters to stage frightening encounters with.

boardgame.name: Uncanny Rally
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

YOU are a poorly-disguised military android on the run from the authorities and en route to a new life of freedom in a robot commune on the West Coast. Have you got what it takes to earn enough gas money to make it there without accidentally destroying half a town?

boardgame.name: Skytear: Unforgotten
boardgame.description:
Unforgotten is an expansion with 2 dual faction heroes that worship both Taulot and Kurumo at once, helping you mix red and green heroes together.
In gameplay terms, when these heroes take a worship action you resolve both the green and red worship in any order of your choice. This is the third release of the dual faction cycle started with Stormsear and Winterdeep.

Unforgotten features a new type of power card with two runes at once that can only be played by heroes with both runes. There are 5 blue/green and 5 red/green power cards.
The same amount of blue/yellow and red/yellow cards will come with Untamed, the last expansion of the dual faction cycle releasing in 2022.

boardgame.name: The Highway Haunter
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

There is a long, lonely stretch of road, winding its way through the Haunted Forest, that everyone says is cursed. The forest gets its name from being haunted, of course, but this one bit of highway is especially notorious. Or at least all the locals know they should avoid it. Travellers from afar still come through in their fancy carriages, or astride their speedy coursers, or even on foot like those foolhardy heroes in the old stories. They don’t all meet the highway haunter, but some of them do.

Enough people have met the mysterious masked man dressed in gold and purple, and been robbed by him, that word has gotten out. While there are some too ashamed to say anything — and others who cannot, having been robbed of their very lives! —some have earned back what was taken from them, and more, in free drinks just from recounting their experience to those eager to hear an exciting tale. The scenario follows a predictable pattern. The road is blocked, and even though it grows dark, the carriage must halt. But then a figure approaches. He never speaks, but only brandishes a golden idol, pointing at it, then pointing at his victim. Those who refuse to hand over their gold are cut down by his mighty sword. Those who attempt to flee are held back by a ray of light that emanates from what appears to be a glowing gemstone worn upon this highwayman’s forehead.

But why does he seek more gold, when he already has enough to fund a retirement? Sometimes, people say, this highwayman does not even keep the gold he takes—he merely throws it away in what seems to be disgust, pointing back to the golden idol in his hand. Other times, what is stolen is found again in the woods, strewn between the trees. Some peasants have gone out during the day, looking for discarded valuables. But some are too afraid to do so, for they have seen this gold and purple figure out there in the woods, even during the day. And yet other peasants have disappeared, never to be found. Their families suspect this, too, is the work of the highway haunter.

boardgame.name: The Deadly Mine of Pantanga
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

I call this a found adventure. There are no hooks and motivations. The party is traveling and they find a cave. Adventurers love caves. Can you ever recall a time when an adventuring party didn't enter a cave? I've decorated the cave with bones. They love that. Wish the party good luck, then smile.

boardgame.name: The Sun's Refrain
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Gold isn’t the only treasure found in the West. There’s also that great fuel of the Transcontinental Railroad: coal. Why have the miners’ hammers fallen silent? Is it disease, a workers’ strike, or perhaps something more sinister that resides underneath? Find the truth and resolve it quietly before investors catch wind of it.

boardgame.name: Prosperity, Are You Going My Way?
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Transcontinental Railroad surges westward into Dakota Territory, but constant raiding has halted its progress leading to Prosperity, a Black-founded town near Cheyenne established through negotiations with local Indigenous Nations. The bandits are well-armed and trained but why are they so obsessed with this tract of land?

NOTE: This Bag of Nails (scenario) has no supernatural and is based in Haunted West’s alternate timeline.

boardgame.name: Home is the Hangman
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The West is dotted with small towns doing the best they can to survive. After the Civil War ended Dahlgren, Kansas was thriving but the town is now nearing its breaking point from mounting mysterious deaths and disappearances. What dark influence is running rampant through the town?

boardgame.name: Irelthki, The Clockwork City
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

New Stop Along the Trail, Irelthki: An underground Clockwork Kingdown hidden below Texas for your Paragons to explore if they gave the grit and gumption. The wonders and horrors come in equal parts.

Note: This is a setting and not a scenario.

boardgame.name: One Was Found
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The dangers of the West aren't just six shooters and land grabs. You are often at the mercy of nature itself. What horrors lurk in the heart of a blizzard that you can’t see but can see you? Save yourself, save the townspeople, and get out of there before hypothermia takes you out instead.

boardgame.name: Ranger Archetype: Adaptive Soldier
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A construct built for war may adopt the Adaptive Soldier Archetype, utilizing not only their abilities to fire a large number of projectiles in battle with uncanny precision, but also the ability to emulate the magical abilities of their defeated foes. You may choose to wield this power in the service of your creator, but others may do so only to prove themselves the mightiest among their fellow constructs.

Building off of the existing Fifth Edition rules to build a ranger character, this PDF contains options to build a construct ranger who uses a unique alloyed armor to copy their defeated enemies' magic.

boardgame.name: NPCs Collection 13
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your players' characters will run into many people during the course of a gaming session. Some will be less than memorable, and some will die at the hands of the party, or other NPCs. But some interactions call for more than a name and job title.

DRP NPC Collections feature four different character descriptions, along with their portraits. Use them as-is, flesh them out, or use just the description or the portrait. Don't be caught off guard when your players say, "We want to talk with this character!"

This system-agnostic collection includes:

Honor Bright - femal pixie valkyrie
Shadowmist - male elven ranger
Bliss Manewave - female dwarf fighter
Na'hala of Dubembe - male human druid

boardgame.name: The Magical Land of Yeld: Rank 1 Adventure Set
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Rank 1 Adventure Set is our biggest expansion yet for The Magical Land of Yeld RPG! This expansion is designed to guide new players through their first Rank 1 adventures, and get them ready to face their first Hunter of Yeld. You can use this book as a direct follow-up to our Mermaid Hunters Starter Set, or as the start for your own unique Yeld campaign!

The Rank 1 Adventure Set will introduce the Friends to the legendary Job Trainer Jocasta Cibo, who will send the young Heroes on a quest into the Plains Region to meet the mysterious Door Watcher and rescue a kidnapped Hydra child. Along the way the Friends will face Tunnel Mummies, Spelling Bees, Toothfacers, Ghost Sharks and the notorious Big Bad Bug Cartel!

Inside this 48 page expansion you'll find:

5 Rank 1 Adventures, complete with detailed Challenges, Monsters, Boss Fights and GM advice!
Game Master advice for creating adventure, adjusting fight difficulty, choosing challenges and building awesome Monsters!
Player advice for choosing your first Heroic Job and spending your Reward dice, including recommendations for must-have Special dice for each Job!
A selection of Rare Rank 1 Weapons and Armor to win, buy or discover!
Meet Bas, a band new Heroic Mascot to add to your party! The more Reward dice you invest in Bas, the more useful she'll become!

boardgame.name: Message to Garcia
boardgame.description:
Message to Garcia is competitive role playing game for 2-3 players and is inspired by Elbert Hubbard’s short essay about 1st Lieutenant Andrew Rowan ability to avoid interception or capture by the Spanish and deliver President William McKinley’s message to General Calixto Garcia, the leader of the Cuban insurgents, hidden somewhere in the Cuban wilderness. Like Rowan, players will be given little information and will have to rely on their initiative and motivation to accomplish their mission.

Message to Garcia was created for the 2021 24-hour RPG contest on RPGGeek.com.

boardgame.name: Mist Legacy
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still in active development and available to the public for purchase in it's unfinished state, either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).





Free to play fantasy MMO.User Summary

boardgame.name: Deadly Streets
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A City Like No Other!

The Big Apple. The City That Never Sleeps. New York has many names, but from 1992 until 2012, it had another that was used more than any other: the Cursed City. Under the sway of the most powerful enchantment in history, New York spent twenty years with no one inside its borders able to take up weapons against one another. What could have been a blessing instead turned the streets red with unarmed brawls taking place between the forces of order and chaos in every back alley. Even in the modern era, this attitude lingers, with the city's heroes facing their nemeses in combat with little more than their powers to keep the peace.

Deadly Streets examines the city of New York, its heroes, and the villains who threaten it. The heroes called the Five Borough Brawlers (don't call them that, they hate it!) stand guard for the common citizen, protecting them from threats like the initiates of the Sacred Weapons, the mystically empowered street gang known as the Warlocks, and the ruthless warlords of the Chain Gaing. With new legacies that characters can take up from the legendary Grand Tournament of 1992 and an optional rule to tweak the system to capture the feel of back-alley combat, Deadly Streets is a must for street-level heroes!

boardgame.name: The Cartographer Society's Guide to Airships
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

There is no greater freedom than the skies!

The Cartographer's Society is one of the most ancient organizations in Aden, and one of the few that have survived. For centuries, they have explored the farthest, most remote reaches of the Known Lands, and the key to their success has been the use of airships. But they are not alone in their work! The Thunder Scouts, rugged warriors beloved by all for their fearlessness, continue to carve new paths through a strange and threatening wilderness. Wherever frontiers exist in the world of Aden, there are explorers from these two organizations pushing them ever back.

The Cartographer Society's Guide to Airships introduces new rules for creating, personalizing, and operating airships of all different shapes and sizes, while also providing essential background on their history and the history of the Society itself. It also delves into the story of the brave Thunder Scouts and how they came to be regarded as folk heroes throughout the Known Lands, along with new chasses and upgrades available to characters who choose to play a Thunder Scout.

In Aden, even the skies are deadly!
boardgame.rpg: Thunderscape: The World of Aden TinyD6

boardgame.name: Therian Saga
boardgame.description:
The Therian Saga is not your typical role-playing game.

Your heroes independently carry out the tasks you assign. Plan their days by making a list of actions to be completed.

Your heroes then go to work and will complete the tasks, regardless of your online status.

Become a legendary hero

Your heroes, with the help of their companions, progress in a world of endless possibilities:

Put on your artisan’s tunic and create masterpieces that will elevate you to the ranks of the kingdom’s greatest artisans.

Become a famous explorer by braving hostile territory, discovering unknown lands and returning with sought-after materials.

Become an experienced laborer, such as a miner or lumberjack, gaining the trust and confidence of the wealthiest lords and providing them with resources with a variety of extraordinary properties.

Study the strange creatures of this new world, then tame and train them to become your most loyal allies.

Grab your shovels, trowels and planes to build estates the people will marvel over, or lay the first bricks of a city that will delight counts, barons and duchesses for decades to come.

And much more…

Once you have selected your specialty, a true learning experience begins, in which your hero gradually builds the skills needed to accomplish legendary feats.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: The Mountain Troll
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A troll, one as big as a mountain, finds its feet again at the banks of the fjord. On its head, it wears a longship like a hat.And are there figures moving about on the deck?

“It is heading for the city!” Liðulfr proclaims. Then he raises a horn to his lips, summoning the guard.

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A set of 50x50 battlemaps depicting a huge rampaging mountain troll. Controlled by smaller trolls that sit in a longship upon it's head, it smashes through the city.
Provided with two backgrounds (city and rural), and also with and without the longship

boardgame.name: Íssborg - Frost Giant Stronghold
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Íssborg, the ancient fortress deep in the Ymiria Mountain Range. Íssborg holds the Forge of Ice
where burns the Kaldr Eldr, the cold fire, that is necessary for the smithing of frost magic
A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 30x50 battlemap depicting a Frost Giant fortress and ice forge

boardgame.name: The Cavern of Ice
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A freezing tunnel beneath a glacier, leading through ancient ruins

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 30x70 battlemap depicting a glacial meltwater stream, flowing beneath a glacier, and moving through a frost giant ruin. Includes version without wrecked skyship

boardgame.name: The Broken Skyship
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A strange sight greets your eyes as you round a rocky prominence. Roughly three-quarters of the way up a concave bowl of snow-covered mountainside, a strange sailboat is marooned far from any sea.

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 30x50 battlemap depicting a wrecked skyship, sitting on the snowy slope of a mountain. Includes a no-wreck version

boardgame.name: Valravn Lair
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Valravn is part raven, part wolf, and all evil
A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 30x50 battlemap depicting a snowy slope leading up to a cave lair.

boardgame.name: Ice Bridge
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Climbing between craggy outcroppings, you come to a bridge of ice stretching across a deep chasm.A strong, chill wind blows through the chasm sending flurries of snow across your path.

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 30x50 battlemap depicting an ice bridge across a snowy chasm, high in the mountains.

boardgame.name: Raven's Perch
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An enormous rock stair, ascending the routes to the ritual site at the mountain's peak.

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 40x50 battlemap depicting a ritual shrine at the top of a rocky, snowy cliff. Includes version without sky-burial platforms.

boardgame.name: Eikhallr - The Hall of the Oak
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Massive stone pillars flow upward into oak and yew trunks, which spread into a gently swaying canopy overhead. Stars glitter through the branches and leaves, and the sky beyond is an unending void.
A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 20 x 30 map depicting a hall, existing in the dream real of Draumheim

boardgame.name: The Rubble Shrine
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This crumbling, ancient shrine was carved inside a large boulder and has barely enough room for a frost giant to enter

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A set of 30x30 battlemaps depicting an ancient shrine, carved into a boulder. Includes interior, with and without portal.

boardgame.name: The Ruined Keep
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Recently, a young linnorm has taken the ruins of a small keep as its lair.The ruins are on a nearby hilltop and can be clearly seen among the scattered trees on the surrounding hills.
A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 30x30 battlemap depicting a ruined keep, with patchy snow. A 10x20 cave is provided.

boardgame.name: The Forgotten Barrow
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hilda’s Barrow lies on a strip of land along the northern shore of the Mikillvatn, at the edge of the forest. As trees and shrubs have rooted and grown upon it, it’s easy to miss that it is a barrow and not a natural hill when given a casual inspection. However, at the base of the eastern face is a scattering of earth around a hole leading into the hillside.

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A set of 20x30 battlemaps depicting an ancient barrow, now resembling a hill. Trolls have dug into it, and are using it as a lair.

boardgame.name: Barrow of the Fallen Lord
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The trees grow steadily larger and twisted as you enter a region of hills.The calls of birds and insects become muted and then silent the deeper you go and the feeling of watching eyes rises the hair on the back of your necks.


A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A set of 30 x 30 maps depicting the burial tomb complex of an undead lord. Includes spike-hall version.

boardgame.name: The Ketta's Hovel
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

On the far side of this glade, a dilapidated hovel leans drunkenly against the trunk of a massive oak tree. Extending out from the base of the hut are two giant bird-like legs now rotted away to bone and withered flesh.
A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 20 x 20 map depicting an old witch's hut, once with bird legs, now rotted away. Includes interior.

boardgame.name: The Hraesvelgar's Nest
The Hræsvelgar's Nest
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Rising up out of the center of a small clearing is a natural spire of stone, easily 100 feet tall. Ledges radiate out of the sides of the sheer rock like a broken stairway leading up to a great tangle of branches, wood and other materials resting at its top.

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 20 x 20 map depicting the nest of giant eagles, perched upon a tall rock spire

boardgame.name: Linnorm Den
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Approaching a small clearing dotted with large boulders and old fallen trees, you see two pale serpentine beasts with draconic heads pursuing a lone, armored human.


A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 20 x 30 map depicting a the forest den of young linnorms

boardgame.name: Vindrbrú Troll Bridge
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A dilapidated bridge spans a chasm before you. Entire chunks of stone have crumbled away, leaving dangerous gaps in the masonry, but for the most part, the bridge still stands. Midway across the bridge, an impossibly large horn is set atop a stone plinth.

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 20 x 30 map depicting an old bridge, spanning a chasm. Guarded by a troll, it is a difficult place to cross

boardgame.name: Tower of the Spectral Boar
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Inside the tower, the skeleton of an enormous boar slumps against one wall, its tusks tangled in the thick vines that cover all the interior walls.

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 20 x 30 map depicting a ruined tower on a spire of rock - haunted by a spectral boar

boardgame.name: Nokkenfoss
Nøkkenfoss
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A traditional longhouse of great size, Stolki’s features multiple long wooden tables with bench seating where food is served morning and night and the mead flows until well after dark.

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A set of 20 x 30 map depicting a waterfall, the home of a Nøkken

boardgame.name: Mountain Pass
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A winding mountain path, high in the peaks

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 20 x 30 map depicting a mountain path

boardgame.name: Svartálfaheim Caverns
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The caverns beneath the Svartálfaheim Mountains are vast and seemingly endless


A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 50x50 depicting a a dark cavern system, cold in places, with winding tunnels and stalactites

boardgame.name: Turing Complete
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still in active development and available to the public for purchase in it's unfinished state, either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).





Turing Complete is a game about computer science. If you enjoy the thrill of figuring things out and those moments where a deeper perspective is revealed about something you thought you understood, this game is for you.What you learn

LOGIC GATES
Logic gates are the fundamental building blocks of computation. Given only a nand gate you create the rest.

COMPONENTS
Building on logic gates and introducing memory, more complex constructions are possible.

ARCHITECTURE
Assemble your components into real computers. Turing complete computers are the gold standard, Turing complete meaning a computer that is capable of computing the same algorithms as a Turing machine.

ASSEMBLY
Computers are programmed with binary codes. Create assembly instructions to simplify this and solve programming puzzles on your own hardware.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Ranundr the Red's Longhouse
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Finally, after trekking some 700 feet up the mountainside, the path you follow splits under the shadow of a sharp tongue of rock that extends perpendicular from the cliff face. A great longhouse sits atop this outthrust stone. Steps carved into the cliff to either side of the rocky protrusion lead upwards through apertures in the longhouse floor. Welcome to the dwelling of Ranundr the Red, Jarl of Nilmgard.

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A set of 20 x 30 map depicting a Norse style longhouse, built onto a spur of rock in the mountain. Included are day & night variants, and exterior and interior views.

boardgame.name: Karvi Skyship
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A karvi longship - turned into a skyship!

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A set of 20x30 battlemaps featuring a Norse karvi style longship converted into a skyship. Includes two backgrounds - city and rural, plus a PNG so you can overlay it on any map.

boardgame.name: Heroic Armory: Supply Drop VI
Heroic Armory: Supply Drop Vol. VI
Inferno
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Aedrenar! A New Post-Apocalyptic Fantasy World full of adventure, designed for masked vigilantes and treasure hunters alike!

Need some new equipment and items for your would-be vigilante? This book introduces a mix of new weapons and equipment useful for any self-respecting crime-fighter or half-decent detective.

Each volume in this new series details a small bit of backstory behind one of Aedrenar's greatest heroes (or villians), and provides some information about some of the gear they carried with them at different times. The best thing, is these heroes have long since had their time (or are prone to lending gear out to fellow heroes), so it can be used in creating your own!

boardgame.name: Potbellied Kobold's Guide to Villains & Lairs: Kerym Abrus
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Obsessed with natural toxins and their effect on the body, Kerym is happy to poison for pay to fund his dark experiments.
Paid handsomely by the wealthy to subtly incapacitate or eliminate their enemies, Kerym enjoys the benefits of wealth and position. He has the freedom and funding to experiment with poisons in a laboratory of his own, and the status to obtain any kind of test subjects he desires.

Your purchase includes:

A PDF of Kerym and the Laboratory
Map Files
VTT Token of Kerym

boardgame.name: Sacred Blood (PF2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Stone and secrets form the foundations of storied Languard, jewel of Ashlar and seat of its power. In spite of its strong walls and numerous allies, the ancient city is poised to fall. Deep within the bowels of Languard’s labyrinthine undercity, a half-forgotten chapel is the only thing keeping the coming darkness at bay. When a failed attempt at ransacking the old chapel weakens its power, a chain of fateful events is set into motion, threatening to drown Languard in a tide of restless dead. Only one person can avert this disaster...but who are they?

You are a GM, but you are busy. You want to write your own modules, but you just don’t have the time. And you don’t want to use commercial modules. You want to make your campaign your own. That’s where Dungeon Backdrop Storylines comes in! Each presents three fully fleshed out and lovingly detailed linked dungeons ready for you to use as you see fit. Stock the dungeons with your own monsters (and—perhaps—their treasure), decide their back story and you are good to go.

This Dungeon Backdrop Storyline is designed for use with the Duchy of Ashlar. However, with minimal effort it can be easily modified to fit almost any campaign world.

boardgame.name: Sacred Blood (OSR)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Stone and secrets form the foundations of storied Languard, jewel of Ashlar and seat of its power. In spite of its strong walls and numerous allies, the ancient city is poised to fall. Deep within the bowels of Languard’s labyrinthine undercity, a half-forgotten chapel is the only thing keeping the coming darkness at bay. When a failed attempt at ransacking the old chapel weakens its power, a chain of fateful events is set into motion, threatening to drown Languard in a tide of restless dead. boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:
